meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unable to be reproduced.
meanings.sent1: The irreproducibility of the experiment made it difficult to verify the results.
meanings.sent2: Scientists faced irreproducibility when trying to recreate the same conditions in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The irreproducibility of the magic trick left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic style had an irreproducibility that made her paintings truly unique.
meanings.sent5: The irreproducibility of the rare flower's bloom fascinated botanists.

meanings.definition: The inability to replicate or duplicate a result or finding.
meanings.sent1: The irreproducibility of the data raised doubts about its accuracy.
meanings.sent2: Researchers encountered irreproducibility when trying to confirm the initial study's results.
meanings.sent3: The irreproducibility of the recipe led to a hilarious cooking disaster.
meanings.sent4: The irreproducibility of his success in the stock market was both frustrating and intriguing.
meanings.sent5: The irreproducibility of the ancient artifact's markings puzzled historians.
